Washtenaw Intermediate School District
July 16 at 9:15 AM ·

We are launching our #SafeSchoolsWashtenaw donation drive today!

Schools are being tasked with preparing for a return to in-person learning. Though we don't exactly know when that is yet, our schools WILL need personal protective equipment and critical supplies when that happens.

Thanks to a generous $100,000 starter grant from #ToyotaUSA, we're kick-starting the #SafeSchoolsWashtenaw campaign with a head start towards our $500,000 fundraising goal.

Washtenaw schools are grappling with the challenge of getting high-need items like masks, hand sanitizer, disinfecting wipes, tissues and gloves during the global pandemic, so we are asking the community for help.

Learn more about donating items or funds here 👇
https://washtenawisd.org/covid-19/safe-schools-washtenaw

All items donated or purchased with donations will be distributed equitably across the county's public schools.

Donate online today or stop by for contactless drop-off starting next week on July 20 to help our 108 public schools in Washtenaw County prepare for a safe return to school!

Activities conducted during this week draw attention to the continuing problem of school violence and educate everyone about how schools can be made safer and more secure. Fortis Academy will have several activities this week to highlight the theme of, “A Safe School Starts with Me.” Please talk to you children about what they are learning this week.

Did you know that October is Bullying Awareness Month?

During the month of October Fortis is focusing on teaching our students to utilize our moral focus of Respect to reduce conflict and help eliminate bullying. We have titled our campaign this year, Fortis Stands for You!

Here are some pictures of how we are raising awareness and involving students. There will be several different activities going on this month as well, so watch for pictures of those as well!
